title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #96: Unit Distances in Convex Polygons**

**Conjecture:** In a convex n-gon, there are O(n) pairs at unit distance.

**Status: OPEN**

**Best bounds:** Upper O(n log n), Lower 2n-7
mathContext: The convexity constraint should limit unit distances more than the general O(n^{4/3}) bound.

title: Unit Distance
content:
**IsUnitDistance p q:**

Two points are at unit distance if dist(p, q) = 1.

We count how many pairs in a convex polygon satisfy this.

title: Convex Position
content:
**inConvexPosition A:**

A set is in convex position if no point lies in the convex hull of the others.

Equivalently, every point is on the boundary of the convex hull.

title: Erdős-Moser Conjecture
content:
**ErdosMoserConjecture:**

∃ C, ∀ convex n-gons A: unitDistanceCount(A) ≤ C·n

This is the main O(n) conjecture.
mathContext: The conjecture says the constant C is independent of the polygon.

title: Erdős-Fishburn Conjecture
content:
**ErdosFishburnConjecture:**

The maximum is exactly 2n (not just O(n)).

This is a stronger, more precise form of the conjecture.

title: Füredi's Bound (1990)
content:
**furedi_bound:**

O(n log n) unit distance pairs in a convex n-gon.

The first major progress on the problem, but still has a log factor.

title: Aggarwal's Bound (2015)
content:
**aggarwal_bound:**

n log₂n + 4n unit distance pairs (current best upper bound).

Improved constants but still has the log factor.

title: Edelsbrunner-Hajnal Construction
content:
**edelsbrunner_hajnal_construction:**

There exist convex n-gons with 2n - 7 unit distance pairs.

This is the best known lower bound, suggesting 2n may be the answer.

title: Sum Conjecture
content:
**ErdosSumConjecture:**

For a convex n-gon A with g(x) = equidistant pairs from x:
∑_{x ∈ A} g(x) < 4n

Another related open conjecture by Erdős.

title: Summary: OPEN
content:
**erdos_96:**

**STATUS: OPEN**

**Known bounds:**
- Upper: n log₂n + 4n (Aggarwal 2015)
- Lower: 2n - 7 (Edelsbrunner-Hajnal 1991)

**The Gap:** Between O(n log n) and O(n). Removing the log factor is the challenge.
